intro: Dactylicapnos torulosa, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Dactylicapnos torulosa is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
